The 'Universidad CatÃ³lica de CÃ³rdoba' ('UCC') ('Catholic University of Cordoba')
('UniversitÃ© Catholique de Cordoba') is a private Jesuit university of Argentina
that was founded on June 8, 1956. UCC now (2010) has over 10,000 students and
twelve academic units. Their 11 faculties are:Engineering, Agricultural
Sciences, Philosophy, Architecture, Medicine and Dentistry, Law, Political
Sciences, Economic sciences, Administration Studies, Education Sciences and
Chemical Sciences.

UCC has a strong commitment to be an âacademically engaged and socially
responsible university.â University Social Responsibility at UCC

UCCâs civic engagement activities centers on an approach it calls University
Social Responsibility (RSU), formally adopted in 2006. RSU emphasizes not only
having civic engagement and community outreach activities, but having social
responsibility permeate every aspect of the university, including its
administration, teaching, research, and outreach. Under the RSU program, UCC
requires that each faculty submit a plan and list of social responsibility
projects that they will undertake in the coming year, either independently or in
collaboration with other academic units. This way, the university ensures that
faculty and students from across the university are involved.

The university also strongly encourages students and staff to volunteer their
time for community service projects through the âVolunteers - Universidad
CatÃ³lica de CÃ³rdobaâ program. Working under the motto of âWe enter to learn,
depart to serve,â the VUCC is composed of students, teachers and young
professionals who work in solidarity, integrating knowledge in an
interdisciplinary way to address various social problems, promote social
awareness and a sense of solidarity, and acknowledge responsibility for the most
vulnerable.

The Catholic University of Cordoba is part of the worldwide network of Jesuit
universities, in over 90 countries and is an active member of the network of
Jesuit Universities of Latin America (AUSJAL). He also participated in various
international networks of universities with which it has academic exchange
agreements, joint degree and mutual cooperation.

In the UCC currently are dictated many degree programs, in many fields
of science.

Among graduate programs, all accredited by the National Assessment and
Accreditation of Universities (CONEAU) - highlights doctoral programs such as a
Doctorate in Medicine, a Ph.D. in Politics and Government, Agricultural
Sciences, Ph.D. in Microelectronics and Chemical Sciences.

The people at the Catholic University of Cordoba believe that the University
can not simply educate for form good professionals, but must be people
critical, compassionate and committed, in a reality that is increasingly torn
by social exclusion and injustice. Therefore, in addition to a current
disciplinary training, the University offers a solid liberal education through
the philosophical content, anthropological, ethical and theological in each of
their careers.

In the Catholic University of CÃ³rdoba people teach to worry, that generates
questions and unfair on the current state of social exclusion, inequality and
misery to which the University have a responsibility, that is an answer to give.

So at the Catholic University of CÃ³rdoba Jesuit University, people work for over
fifty four years, by training people on Science, Consciousness and Commitment.
